title: TRELLO-001: Initialize project structure
description: Create trello-mentoring-generator directory with standard Python project layout. Include README.md, requirements.txt (requests, python-dotenv), .env.example, src/ directory with __init__.py, and tests/ directory. Steps: 1) Create directory structure, 2) Initialize requirements.txt with dependencies, 3) Create .env.example template with TRELLO_API_KEY and TRELLO_TOKEN placeholders

title: TRELLO-002: Implement Trello REST API client
description: Create src/trello_client.py with TrelloClient class using requests library. Implement methods: create_board(name, description), create_list(board_id, name, position), create_card(list_id, name, description, labels), create_label(board_id, name, color), create_checklist(card_id, name), add_checklist_item(checklist_id, name). Include proper error handling, rate limit awareness, and response validation. Steps: 1) Implement TrelloClient class with auth, 2) Add CRUD methods for boards/lists/cards/labels/checklists, 3) Add error handling and response validation

title: TRELLO-003: Define tech career template with dataclasses
description: Create src/templates/tech_career.py with dataclass definitions for BoardTemplate, ListDef, CardDef, LabelDef, ChecklistDef. Define TECH_CAREER_TEMPLATE constant with 4 Kanban lists (Backlog, In Progress, Review, Done), 6 mentoring cards (Resume Review, Interview Prep, Coding Practice, Portfolio Building, Networking, Goal Setting) with descriptions and checklists, and 6 labels (Priority High/Medium/Low, Type Skill/Career/Networking). Steps: 1) Define dataclasses for template structure, 2) Create TECH_CAREER_TEMPLATE with all lists/cards/labels, 3) Add checklist items for each card

title: TRELLO-004: Implement board generator orchestration
description: Create src/board_generator.py with BoardGenerator class that orchestrates template creation. Implement generate(template, board_name, description) method that: 1) Creates board via TrelloClient, 2) Creates all labels, 3) Creates lists in order, 4) Creates cards with descriptions and labels, 5) Creates checklists with items. Include dry-run mode that logs actions without API calls. Steps: 1) Implement BoardGenerator class, 2) Add generate() method with proper sequencing, 3) Add dry-run support with logging

title: TRELLO-005: Create CLI entry point with argparse
description: Create generate_board.py CLI using argparse. Arguments: --name (required, board name), --description (optional, board description), --template (optional, default 'tech_career'), --dry-run (flag, preview without creating). Load environment variables from .env file. Print board URL on success. Steps: 1) Implement argparse CLI with all arguments, 2) Load .env and validate credentials, 3) Call BoardGenerator and print results

title: TRELLO-006: Add unit tests with mocked API
description: Create tests/test_board_generator.py with pytest tests. Mock requests.Session to avoid real API calls. Test cases: 1) TrelloClient creates board with correct payload, 2) TrelloClient handles API errors gracefully, 3) BoardGenerator creates resources in correct order, 4) BoardGenerator dry-run logs without API calls, 5) CLI parses arguments correctly. Steps: 1) Set up pytest with responses/unittest.mock, 2) Write tests for each component, 3) Verify all tests pass
